snippet: With the American-led coalition ceding a greater role in the fight to Afghan security forces, the Taliban has made one of their aims exposing the Afghan forces as incapable of protecting themselves.
abstract: Taliban keeps up its steady campaign against Afghanistan’s still unsteady security forces, killing at least 11 soldiers in a pair of attacks in the country’s south and east; with the American-led coalition increasingly ceding a greater role to Afghan forces, one of the chief aims of the Taliban and its insurgent allies has been to show that the Afghan Army and police force are incapable of protecting themselves, let alone ordinary people.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori and Afghan employees of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With the American-led coalition ceding a greater role in the fight to Afghan security forces, the Taliban has made one of their aims exposing the Afghan forces as incapable of protecting themselves.

headline.seo: Taliban Kill 11 Afghan Soldiers in 2 Attacks
headline.main: Taliban Step Up Attacks, Killing 11 Afghan Soldiers
headline.print_headline: Taliban Kill 11 in Stepped-Up Attacks on Afghan Soldiers
